Topic.Title: Everybody [many at least] speaks so well of this company.. but the stock does nothing

Message.Msg: Those few tech giants that have "arrived" have done it thru True Innovation. And have provided the world with something truly unique and valuable that no one else has. Qualcomm did it by inventing and patenting the world's wireless protocols. And now derives income, either directly or indirectly, on Each and Every wireless device manufactured on the planet. Intel Corporation did it by inventing and patenting the x86 processor. And today owns 90%+ of the computer processor business. So how is nvidia going to "arrive"? Hummm? By making mail-order design ARM chips, which they license from ARM Holdings Plc? Along with 700 other licensees that have purchased the exact same chip design blueprints. Which is now so competitive that nvidia will Lose a Third of a Billion Dollars making the "tegra" mail-order design ARM chips. Ha ha ha ha ha! Struggling nvidia will never "arrive". Ever. 'Cause they can't provide the world with something truly unique and valuable that no one else has.

And now INtel has to dump their chips for design wins... And some on this board appear shocked that INtel is around its 52-week low...

Topic.Title: How Intel secured the Chinese Supercomputer Deal (feat. Ivy Bridge-EP + Xeon Phi)

Message.Msg: Wow! Intel's Xeon E5 + Xeon Phi chips have won the #1 Best and Fastest Supercomputer on the Planet. THE #1 Fastest, boys. Let's read excerpts about how 200,000 Intel parts will exclusively power THE Fastest, Most Powerful Supercomputer in the History of Mankind, shall we? "Sometimes in the next 18 months, Intel will power the world's most powerful supercomputer. Consisted of approximately 100,000 Ivy Bridge-EP based Xeon E5's and 100,000 Xeon Phi boards (Knights Landing), the Chinese supercomputer should be the world's most powerful, reaching no less than 100 PFLOPS of compute power. ... the supercomputer should reach 100 PFLOPS, approximately 10 times faster than the fastest supercomputer in 2011 and five times faster than the current fastest supercomputer. This project is heavily backed by the Chinese government and Ministry of Sciences, viewed as the system needed to aid the China space exploration, as well as rising the health research to a new degree. The government sees that within the next couple of decades, it will have to start battling the older population, predict where to build cities, calculate the highway system (by 2020, China plans to build more new highways than the current total in the United States, for example - and have twice as much highways than U.S. by 2030), public transportation system as well as wild projects such as intelligent license plates, real time traffic calculation to suggest preferred speed to reduce stoppages on the roads etc. ... this will be the fastest supercomputer for some time. ... the Chinese supercomputer will be a majestic rig indeed, with over 200,000 pieces of silicon processing weather simulations, calculating Chinese space projects (manned missons to the Moon by 2020, Mars by 2025), and many more. ... Intel will earn some nice dollars off the special warranty arrangements." Intel will power the #1, Numero Uno Fastest Supercomputer on the Planet. "THIS will be the fastest supercomputer for some time." 10 times faster than the fastest supercomputer in 2011. Using over 200,000 pieces of Intel designed and manufactured silicon. And the sour grapes whining from nvidia begins....

If you want to GUESS an earnings miss so be it, if you are right it would a lucky guess as you never seem to offer up anything empirical other than do some T4 research. Topic.Title: How Intel secured the Chinese Supercomputer Deal (feat. Ivy Bridge-EP + Xeon Phi)

Message.Msg: That Intel powered, #1 Fastest Supercomputer of the planet, -- consisting of 100,000 Genuine Intel Xeon E5's chips and 100,000 Genuine Intel Xeon Phi (Knights Landing) chips -- will have a lot of processing cores. Yes a LOT, boys. Let's count them, shall we? In the Intel spec sheets it says that, "The Xeon E KNC Processor has 8 cores." So 8 cores times 100,000 Xeon E KNC chips = 800,000 core processors. PLUS, "The Xeon Phi Accelerator Chip has 60 cores." 60 cores times 100,000 Xeon Phi Accelerator Chips = 6,000,000 cores. So in total, the Intel powered, #1 Fastest Supercomputer on the planet will have Six Million Eight Hundred Thousand (6,800,000) processing cores. 6,800,000 processing cores, boys. Makes those 72-core tegra #4 devices look like a little piker, right? It sure does.

Message.Msg: Given that electricity is quite expensive in China, it not surprising that the Chinese Government and Ministry of Sciences picked the highly energy efficient Intel Xeon Phi accelerators over the nvidia Tesla chips. 'Cause as we know, the nvidia Tesla sucks juice like a Chinese Elephant.
